isis.stitle: STEERABLE DRIVE AXLE END UNIT: FABCO - INSTALL

step1.para: Screw the lower kingpin ball stud into the spindle yoke until the top of the threaded portion is flush with the inside surface of the yoke. Make sure that the locating pin for the lower kingpin lockwasher is in the yoke, then loosely install the lockwasher and nut (do not engage the locating pin into the lockwasher at this time).

Smear the spherical portion of the lower kingpin ball stud with grease. Roll the jack forward and grasping the assembly with both hands, place the lower ball stud into its bearing in the suspension yoke. Raise the jack and rotate the top of the spindle yoke over the upper axle tube yoke.

Smear grease in the upper kingpin bearing and start the upper ball stud through the bearing and into its bore in the suspension yoke. Place one upper kingpin washer on the upper kingpin bolt and insert the bolt up through the suspension yoke and upper kingpin ball stud. Install the other washer and the 7/8" locknut on the bolt and tighten to 500 ft-lbs. (678 N·m).
After wiping both mounting surfaces clean of grease, push the steering arm or upper kingpin cap down over its mounting studs. Install the four 3/4" nuts, and tighten to 250 ft-lbs. (339 N·m).

Slowly tighten the upper kingpin adjusting screw until upward motion of the drive end stops. If a finger is placed near the gap between the suspension and spindle yokes, the point at which upward travel stops can be determined.
Significant additional resistance will also be felt in the effort required to turn the adjusting screw.

Fill the gap between the suspension and spindle yokes in the area of the lower kingpin ball stud with a stack of feeler gauges. There should be enough gauges in the stack to fit the gap snugly ( Figure 14).

Tighten the lower kingpin ball stud until the feeler gauge stack loosens, indicating that the ball stud threads are actually beginning to spread the suspension and spindle yokes apart. Back off the ball stud 1/4 turn.
Turn the lower kingpin ball stud just enough (either direction) to allow the closest hole in the lower kingpin lockwasher to engage the locating pin. Tighten the locknut to 600 ft-lbs. (813 N·m).
Back out the upper kingpin adjusting screw 1/4 turn and tighten the jam nut to 45 ft-lbs. (61 N·m).
Connect the air line to the brake chamber.
Remove the steerable end removal tool.
